column4: hey, im planning on installing MEPIS and then updating to ubuntu...
what do i need to change in the apt preferences files to get it to point to ubuntu correctly
and i want to change it to ubuntu
'stable' 'testing' 'unstable' are not the same in ubuntu
im just going to change the packages from the debian source to the ubuntu source
Saying it's a debian system doesn't really mean much.
i ran Gentoo for a while, ALSA has OSS emulation
until the entire GNU community switches to ALSA there will be OSS emulation
just go into a terminal and run alsamixer
All the rest are already installed.
No, it won't install on Ubuntu.
